DataElement.preferredName: Modified Toxicity Criteria Fatigue Condition Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the modified toxicity criteria for fatigue grade.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: National Marrow Donor Program Modified Toxicity Criteria Fatigue Condition
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Criteria established by the National Marrow Donor Program (NMDP) that assesses potential toxicities following peripheral blood or bone marrow stem cell collection from donors and includes: fever in absence of infections; fatigue; rashes; injection site reaction; nausea; vomiting; loss of appetite; inability to sleep; dizziness, vertigo, or lightheadedness; fainting; and pain.:Overall tiredness and lack of energy._A state of being, such as a state of health.
